definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Long, long ago, there is a student who likes to travel.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，有個讀書人喜歡遊山玩水。

sentences.english: Determination is the most important thing for the reader.
sentences.chinese: 立志是讀書人最要緊的一件事。

sentences.english: Therefore, only reading their own people in order to experience one of the stand.
sentences.chinese: 所以，只有讀書人自己才能體會其中的甘苦。

sentences.english: He was an intellectual who understood Hebrew but could not look up a train timetable correctly.
sentences.chinese: 他是懂得希伯來文，卻看不懂火車時刻表的讀書人。

sentences.english: Do the kindheartedness of ConfucianSchool really exist in every scholar's heart?
sentences.chinese: 儒家的仁愛之學真的存在與每一個讀書人心理嗎？

sentences.english: Scholars of the Tang Dynasty attached great importance to imperial examinations.
sentences.chinese: 唐代的讀書人都很重視科甲取仕。

sentences.english: He looks like a student. I have no idea where he is from.
sentences.chinese: 看他的樣子像個讀書人，也不知道是哪裏人。

sentences.english: At the local villages, they represent the "knowledge book knowledge Ceremony" of the scholars.
sentences.chinese: 在地方鄉村中，他們代表了“知書識禮”的讀書人。

definition: to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it

the Five Classics of Confucianism, namely: the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1], the Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], and the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
proposition (logic, math.)/to assign an essay topic
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
